# uBlock Origin by [Raymond Hill](/en-US/firefox/user/11423598/)
Finally, an efficient wide-spectrum content blocker. Easy on CPU and memory.
[RecommendedRecommended](https://support.mozilla.org/kb/add-on-badges?utm_content=promoted-addon-badge&utm_medium=referral&utm_source=addons.mozilla.org)Available on Firefox for Android‚Ñ¢Available on Firefox for Android‚Ñ¢[4.8 (21,060 reviews)4.8 (21,060 reviews)](/en-US/firefox/addon/ublock-origin/reviews/)9,970,040 Users9,970,040 Users[Download Firefox and get the extension](https://www.mozilla.org/firefox/download/thanks/?s=direct&utm_campaign=amo-fx-cta-607454&utm_content=rta%3AdUJsb2NrMEByYXltb25kaGlsbC5uZXQ&utm_medium=referral&utm_source=addons.mozilla.org)[Download file](https://addons.mozilla.org/firefox/downloads/file/4578681/ublock_origin-1.66.4.xpi)
## Extension Metadata
ScreenshotsAbout this extensionuBlock Origin is **not** an "ad blocker", it's a wide-spectrum content blocker with CPU and memory efficiency as a primary feature.

***

Out of the box, uBO blocks ads, trackers, coin miners, popups, etc. through the following lists of filters, enabled by default:

- EasyList (ads)
- EasyPrivacy (tracking)
- Peter Lowe‚Äôs Ad server list (ads and tracking)
- Online Malicious URL Blocklist
- uBO's own lists

More lists are available for you to select if you wish:

- EasyList Cookie
- Fanboy Annoyances
- AdGuard Annoyances
- Dan Pollock‚Äôs hosts file
- And many others

Additionally, you can point-and-click to block JavaScript locally or globally, create your own global or local rules to override entries from filter lists, and many more advanced features.

***

Free.
Open source with public license (GPLv3)
For users by users.

If ever you really do want to contribute something, think about the people working hard to maintain the filter lists you are using, which were made available to use by all for free.

***

- Access browser tabs

- Access browser activity during navigation

- Access your data for all websites
